class_notes: This course fulfills the Intermediate Breadth in Ecology/Environmental Health for ENVS majors. For ENVSMIN, may be used to fulfill the Ecology and Conservation Breadth area. For students in the Sustainability Science (SUSTSCI) minors, may be used to fulfill Natural Science course.
course_description: This course will view ecology through the lens of social value. Students will learn about the foundations of ecological principles and how quantitative ecological models can be used with structured decision-making to address socio-ecological challenges.
prerequisites: ENVS 120 or ENVS 130 or ENVS 131 or ENVS_OX 131 or ENVS 140 or equivalent transfer credit as prerequisite.
sections: Class Nbr: 4524, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: TTh 1-2:15p, Instructor: E. Lonsdorf, Status: Open
